title: PDF Print Scale Won't Go Above 100%
content:
TL;DR: It lets me change the print scale to 101-200% for pdfs, but making it bigger doesn't actually change the preview image or resulting print, it just leaves it at 100%. As far as I can tell, making the pdf smaller than 100% works as it should and the print scale for websites works as it should for all possible sizes.


I wanted to print some labels and to do so I need to get the size exactly right, so I printed the page normally and measured the size of the page I printed and compared it to the size of the labels, 262 & 272 respectively. 272/262 = about 103.8% so I tried setting the scale to 103% and printed it again, but when I measured that page it was exactly the same as the 100% scale. Then I looked back and realized that although the preview reloaded whenever I raised the number the image didn't actually change, setting it to 200% looked the same as 100% and 150% and etc. I think this must be a bug, but so that's one part of this, but does anyone know of any workarounds in the meantime?

title: Opening devtools make tab unresponsive
content:
I am developing a website (using AstroJS, but i don't think that's the problem) and since yesterday I am experiencing issues when opening devtools. Once I open devtools the whole FF tab becomes unresponsive, I cannot even refresh the page until they are done loading. I can change devtool tabs from 'inspector' to 'console' to 'network' etc but especially 'network' and 'debug' tabs are blank.

I run a 'performance' capture and got [https://profiler.firefox.com/public/rsz6dx1v45m8d4yxyymd9vsx4acw0v1xq2p5g80/calltree/?globalTrackOrder=bc0wa&hiddenGlobalTracks=1w8&hiddenLocalTracksByPid=17464-0w2~15252-0~4872-0~8732-0~12200-013&implementation=js&thread=e&v=10 [https://profiler.firefox.com/public/rsz6dx1v45m8d4yxyymd9vsx4acw0v1xq2p5g80/calltree/?globalTrackOrder=bc0wa&hiddenGlobalTracks=1w8&hiddenLocalTracksByPid=17464-0w2~15252-0~4872-0~8732-0~12200-013&implementation=js&thread=e&v=10 these results. In the test I have only opened the devtools and switched to the inspector tab which is unresponsive. The CPU usage is at around 90% however, I don't really know how to read the finding and understand what the problem is.

So anyone that can help me understand what is going on here?
creator: cgeocodgod

title: I’ve Tried Everything For Several Hours And Nothing Works. Please Delete My Account.
content:
Yesterday, using the Firefox app on my iPhone, I changed the primary email address of my Firefox account and entered the confirmation code that I received. Then I entered a secondary email address in my Firefox account and confirmed it, too. Next I successfully enabled two factor authentication for my Firefox account and created backup authentication codes, also. Everything seemed to work fine. But when I opened the iOS Firefox app later that night, I saw a small warning triangle in the lower right hand corner of the browser. When I clicked on it, I saw a message that said “Enter your password to connect “. But after configuring everything on my Firefox account in the iOS Firefox app, I hadn’t signed out. So it seemed strange that I was being told that I needed to sign in, again. When I clicked on that message, a screen appeared that said, “Sync and Save Data - Sign In with Your Camera - On your computer open Firefox and go to firefox.com/pair”. Under that message, there were two buttons, one that read “Ready to Scan” and another that read “Use Email Instead”. Since I’m exclusively using an iPhone, I didn’t have a computer to use so that I could scan the QR code. So I clicked on “Use Email Instead”, thinking that I’d be able to sign in that way. But instead of a normal sign in screen, I was shown one that said “Set your password - Account no longer exists. Recreate it?” That message was prominently displayed in a red box over my old email address (?). What is that doing there, I thought to myself. At the bottom of the screen, I was instructed to “Choose what to sync” with check boxes beside the words “Bookmarks - History - Open Tabs - Passwords”. And under that was a final click box that read “Create account”. This has taken up way too much of my time tonight. I’ve tried everything, but I can’t get my Firefox account to work properly. I’ve even tried to delete it numerous times. But each time I got the error message that my password was incorrect. So then I reset my password. But again when I tried to delete my account, I got an error message saying that my password was incorrect. And so on and so on and so on. I give up. I’ll just go back to using Safari. I never had this many problems when I used it. Since your system won’t let me delete my account, please do it for me. The email addresses that I’ve tried to use to get my Firefox account to work correctly are jonathan.t.davis@gmail.com and web.services@skiff.com and my.web.accounts@icloud.con. I hope that you’ll delete my account soon. I don’t like leaving stray accounts open across the internet. In my experience, sooner or later there’s a network breach at some organization and my email addresses and other information are divulged. Thank you, Jonathan Davis

P.S. It’s late and I’m tired, but I wanted to tell you, don’t be fooled by the last screenshot. I’ve supposedly successfully deleted my account several times. But when I try to create a new account using any of the email addresses above, your somehow magically resurrects my “deleted” account over and over again.
creator: jonathan.t.davis

title: Profile keeps corrupting
content:
Hello everyone! I keep running into problems with my Firefox account. I have just recently switched to firefox and in the few days that I have been using the browser it keeps crashing on me with the reasoning of my profile being corrupted. I will attach an image of the error message below (Unfortunately it is in German, but it roughly translates to: "The use of a older Firefox-Version can lead to corrupt bookmarks and chronics of the Firefox-Profile. Protect this information, by making a new profile for this installation of Firefox.") What I tried to fix this issue: - Restaring Firefox (Message persists) - Reinstalling Firefox - Reinstalling Firefox after deleting all files

Both firefox reinstallations were with the newest version. The profile that I made for Firefox was made just a few days ago, so I am very confused how this can already be so corrupted. I hope there is something I can do to fix this, I am really enjoying this browser. (；′⌒`) Greetings, Leonie
creator: leonie.deporta

title: Bing becomes default browser and I don't have access to Add-ons and Themes
content:
For the last few days I have had a problem that Bing becomes my default search engine. Even when I go to Google.com it will still reroute to Bing. I searched the forums for solutions and none worked. I couldn't even get into Add-ons and Themes. I would just get a blank page.


Resolution: Finally I decided the best way to deal with this is to delete and re-install Firefox. I saved my Bookmarks first. Then I went to install/uninstall and went to uninstall Firefox, but it gave me another option when I hit it to Refresh Firefox. I chose that option and it reset Firefox to all default/original settings. I didn't even have to import Bookmarks as it kept them and 2 of the Add-ons that I use were optioned to reinstall. The only thing I ended up doing was adding the Menu Bar back on and adding a home page button under Customize Toolbar.

Hope this helps others.

title: program help

But, my specific question is what is a good number to have when the it says a given number of disk space can be cleaned up? For example, I believe when I first tried to clean the disk it said 5.1 GB of disk space could be cleaned. When I ran the disk clean process and it completed it then said 66 KB of disk space could be cleaned. So how much disk space did I gain or get cleaned up? And, if I can only clean up 66 KB of disk space is that indicative of not really needing to clean the disk any farther? Hopefully some one can help.
